intro: Calyptrogyne fortunensis, commonly known as the Florida sand pine, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a small evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant has small, needle-like leaves and produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Calyptrogyne fortunensis is adapted to coastal and inland dune environments, showing resilience to salt spray and drought.
